comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
On right lower corner is scratched "C C HARRIS FOTO" after Charles C. Harris.  
Friederich Katz in his "PANCHO VILLA" (LIFE AND TIMES OF PANCHO VILLA, English version) writes:
"Charles C. Harris was an American photographer that spent some time among revolutionary troops and cominicated what he observed to the United States consul in Chihuahua.  "He was impressed by the revolutionaries armamentary, discipline and ideology."
(page 126, in Spanish version, Ediciones Era, 2007, printing).
The picture was taken between March (most likely, because by the end of this month Harris gave his comunication to the consul, and he sent the observations to the Department of State on March 29 [Department of State Files. 812.00-1222.])  and May 1911.
At Villa's right stands Calixto Contreras, to his left Fidel Ávila.
Above Contreras seems to be most likely Pascual Orozco, by the type of hat and the tilt he used to wear.
Dr. Roberto Duarte
Plastic Surgeon
